smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. All 19 diagram pages contain at least one element.

In use case diagrams on pages 2 and 3, all use case ovals are associated with at least one actor. Page 2: 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet', 'Tuvasta kasutaja' are connected to actors (Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, Autode haldur, Süsteem). Page 3: All 7 use cases are connected to Autode haldur and/or Juhataja.

No duplicate use case names with same actors found. All use cases on pages 2-3 have unique names: 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', 'Vaata autode koondaruannet', 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Registreeri auto', 'Lõpeta auto', 'Muuda autot', 'Aktiveeri auto', 'Muuda auto mittaktiivseks', 'Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid', 'Unusta auto'.

On page 1, the package 'Klassifikaatorite register' contains the element 'Auto_mark' listed twice (appears both as 4th item and as the last item in the package). This is a duplicate element name within the same package.

No redundant data columns without FK relationships found. Common columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear across multiple tables (pages 14-19), but these represent different contextual data for different classifiers (Auto_kategooria, Riik, Isiku_seisundi_liik, etc.), not redundant copies of the same data.

All use cases follow consistent verb-first naming pattern. Page 2: 'Tuvasta' (Identify), 'Vaata' (View). Page 3: 'Registreeri' (Register), 'Lõpeta' (End), 'Muuda' (Change), 'Aktiveeri' (Activate), 'Unusta' (Forget). All start with Estonian imperative verbs.

On page 9 state diagram 'Auto seisundidiagramm', all states are reachable: Ootel is reached from Algus (initial), Aktiivne is reached from Ootel, Mitteaktiivne is reached from Aktiivne, Lõpetatud is reached from Ootel/Aktiivne/Mitteaktiivne, and Unustatud is reached from Ootel. Every state has at least one incoming transition.

On page 4 activity diagram 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm', all actions are reachable from the start node: Algus → 'Vaata kõiki autosid' → decision nodes → 'Otsi autot', 'Vali auto', 'Lõpeta valitud auto' → Lõpp. All actions have incoming flows from the start node path.

All relationships in class and database diagrams (pages 5-19) have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: Page 5 shows '1' and '0..*' on all associations. Page 14 shows multiplicities like '0..*' and '1' on FK relationships. Page 17 shows '0..*' and '1' on all table relationships.

Counted central elements per diagram - maximum found was 9 on page 15 (Klassifikaatorite register): Tootaja_roll, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_kytuse_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_kategooria = 9 tables. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present. Other diagram counts: Page 2: 4 use cases, Page 3: 7 use cases, Page 12: 7 classes, Page 9: 5 states.

Counted visual connection lines per element. Maximum found was 5 lines on page 7 (Klassifikaator has 5 inheritance lines to subtypes) and page 12 (Auto has 5 association lines to classifiers). Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows related elements are positioned at reasonable distances. No relationships show distances exceeding twice the average distance between elements. Layouts are balanced with related elements placed in proximity.

All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs. Use cases: 'Tuvasta' (Identify), 'Vaata' (View), 'Registreeri' (Register), 'Lõpeta' (End), 'Muuda' (Change), 'Aktiveeri' (Activate), 'Unusta' (Forget). Activity actions on page 4: 'Vaata', 'Otsi' (Search), 'Vali' (Select), 'Lõpeta'. All are Estonian imperative verb forms.

All names have ≥4 characters. Shortest names found: 'Isik' (4 chars), 'Auto' (4 chars), 'Riik' (4 chars), 'kood' (4 chars). Threshold is ≤3 characters. Since all names have 4 or more characters, smell is NOT present.

All class names start with uppercase and are singular. Examples: 'Isik' (not 'isik' or 'Isikud'), 'Auto' (not 'Autod'), 'Klient' (not 'Kliendid'), 'Töötaja' (not 'Töötajad'), 'Klassifikaator', 'Riik', 'Kasutajakonto'.

All attribute/column names start with lowercase. Examples from Isik table (page 14): 'isik_id', 'isikukood', 'e_meil', 'eesnimi', 'perenimi', 'reg_aeg', 'synni_kp'. Examples from Auto table (page 17): 'auto_kood', 'nimetus', 'mudel', 'reg_number', 'vin_kood'. No uppercase-starting attributes found.

All database table names are singular. Tables on pages 14-19: 'Isik' (not 'Isikud'), 'Kasutajakonto', 'Riik', 'Auto' (not 'Autod'), 'Klient', 'Tootaja', 'Tootaja_rolli_omamine', 'Auto_kategooria', 'Auto_mark', etc. All follow singular naming convention.

No disallowed type prefixes found in names. No 'tbl_', 'uc_', 'str', 'int' or similar type prefixes detected. The prefixes 'PK_', 'FK_', 'pfK', and 'IXFK_' that appear (e.g., 'PK_Isik', 'FK_Auto_Auto_mark', 'IXFK_Auto_Tootaja') are explicitly allowed for primary keys, foreign keys, and indexes.
